definitions.definition: a real or imaginary straight line going through the centre of a object that is spinning, or a line that divides a symmetrical shape into two equal halves:
examples: The earth revolves around the axis that joins the North and South Poles.

definitions.definition: a fixed line on a graph used to show the position of a point:
examples: Plot distance on the vertical y-axis against time on the horizontal x-axis.

definitions.definition: the countries, including Germany, Italy, and Japan, that fought against the Allies in the Second World War:
